newsitem.title: UK: IPE crude and gas oil stable, may slip on gasoline.
newsitem.headline: IPE crude and gas oil stable, may slip on gasoline.

text.p: IPE Brent crude and gas oil futures traded sideways on Tuesday with neither market finding the impetus to make a break out of a tight trading range, brokers said.
By 1200 GMT September Brent stood nine cents up at $18.50 a barrel around the middle of a seven cent range. August gas oil was unchanged at $167 a tonne holding a $1 trading range.
Brokers were mostly looking to NYMEX gasoline for direction but sentiment for this was seen turning bearish.
GNI Research said in their daily report gasoline's rise through 65 cents on Monday was constructive.
But they added the August contract was becoming increasingly vulnerable from a technical perspective and there may be increases in volatility.
Tom James at Credit Lyonais Rouse in Singapore said, "NYMEX gasoline is looking ready for an extended technical correction to lower numbers, the RSI's are very overbought".
He recommended placing sell-stops below 63.70 cents on the prompt contract and a reduction in overall length.
IPE gas oil remained well above trendline support on the daily spot month continuation chart stemming from July 15s low of $160 through $162-$163.25, coming in today at around $165.75.

Prices made good headway either side of the weekend peaking at $167.75 on Friday on the back of stronger crude and briefly breaking resistance at $168 a double top from July 3 and July 17 on Monday, but analysts said the market needs to break this level more convincingly to go any higher.
